Detectors¶

Detectors are high-level abstractions of Keras object detection architectures. They share a common API.

class mira.detectors.Detector[source]¶
compute_inputs(images)[source]¶

Convert images into suitable model inputs. You usually should not need this method. For training, use detector.train(). For detection, use detector.detect().

Parameters:images – The images to convert
Returns:The input to the model
Return type:ndarray
compute_targets(collection)[source]¶

Compute the expected outputs for a model. You usually should not need this method. For training, use detector.train(). For detection, use detector.detect().

Parameters:collection – The scene collection for which the outputs should be calculated.
Returns:The output(s) as a list of numpy arrays
Return type:Union[List[ndarray], ndarray]
detect(image, threshold=0.5)[source]¶

Run detection for a given image.

Parameters:image – The image to run detection on
Returns:A list of annotations
Return type:List[Annotation]
detect_batch(images, threshold=0.5, batch_size=32)[source]¶

Perform object detection on a batch of images.

Parameters:
  • images – A list of images
  • threshold – The detection threshold for the images
  • batch_size – The batch size to use with the underlying model
Returns:

A list of lists of annotations.
Return type:

List[List[Annotation]]
freeze_backbone()[source]¶

Freeze the body of the model, leaving the final classification and regression layer as trainable.

mAP(collection, iou_threshold=0.5)[source]¶

Compute the mAP metric for a given collection of ground truth scenes.

Parameters:
  • collection – The collection to evaluate
  • iou_threshold – The IoU threshold required for a match
Returns:

mAP score
train(training, validation=None, batch_size=1, augmenter=None, train_shape=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Run training job. All additional keyword arguments passed to Keras’ fit_generator. Note that, at a minimum, you must provide the epochs and steps_per_epoch arguments. If validation data is provided, you will also need to provide a validation_steps argument.

Parameters:
  • training – The collection of training images
  • validation – The collection of validation images
  • batch_size – The batch size to use for training
  • augmenter – The augmenter for generating samples
unfreeze_backbone()[source]¶

Unfreeze the body of the model, making all layers trainable.

There are currently four implemented architectures.

  • YOLO v3
  • RetinaNet
  • EAST Text Detector
  • Advanced EAST Text Detector
  • MTCNN
